div.p: This sub-element is found within expressed, tagg it as BIOGRAPHY FAMILY . It captures the fact that a woman had no children. We hope to facilitate research on the material effects of having or not having children on a woman writer's life. In order to do so, we must systematize information about women who did not have children. This element also allows us to capture discussions of significant issues such as infertility that led to life-long childlessness and how that affected the writer's life.

div.codeblock: <CHILDLESSNESS>MSâ€™s single recorded pregnancy resulted in the birth of a stillborn son.</CHILDLESSNESS>

<CHILDLESSNESS>Their decision not to have children seems to have sprung entirely from his preference . . . . Her diary somewhat cryptically records quarrels over the issue of having children; yet she evidently never insisted.</CHILDLESSNESS>

div.p: If you know that a woman had no children, say so within this element. If she never married but you have no proof she never had children, do not lightly assume she was childless. Stillborn births, infertility problems and miscarriages can be mentioned here but should in any case be mentioned within a HEALTH tag, attribute value FEMALEBODY. You may mention them in CHILDLESSNESS only if she never had any children or if childlessness was a long-term issue for her: using this element signifies that a woman was childless all or most of her life or remained without surviving offspring.
